gov.usgs.locator

Class LocInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.locator.LocInput

  • public class LocInput
extends java.lang.Object
    Locator inputs needed to relocate an event. This class is designed to contain all inputs needed for a location pass. An object of this class should be created from the users inputs and will drive subsequent processing.

      LocInput()

    • Method Detail

      • addLoc

        public void addLoc(java.lang.String earthModel,
                   long originTime,
                   double sourceLat,
                   double sourceLon,
                   double sourceDepth,
                   double bayesDepth,
                   double bayesSpread,
                   boolean heldLoc,
                   boolean heldDepth,
                   boolean useBayes,
                   boolean useRstt,
                   boolean noSvd,
                   boolean newLoc)
        The following Locator input parameters control an event relocation.
        Parameters:
        earthModel - The name of the Earth model to be used (default AK135).
        originTime - The current source origin time in milliseconds.
        sourceLat - The current geographic source latitude in degrees.
        sourceLon - The current geographic source longitude in degrees.
        sourceDepth - The current source depth in kilometers.
        bayesDepth - The analyst specified Bayesian depth in kilometers.
        bayesSpread - The analyst specified Bayesian depth standard deviation in kilometers.
        heldLoc - True if the current location cannot be changed.
        heldDepth - True if the current depth cannot be changed.
        useBayes - True if the analyst supplied Bayesian depth and spread should be used.
        useRstt - True if the RSTT regional Earth model should be used.
        noSvd - True if the singular valued decomposition (i.e., pick de-correlation) should not be used.
        newLoc - True if the current location has changed outside of the Locator.

      • addPick

        public void addPick(java.lang.String source,
                    int pickID,
                    java.lang.String stationCode,
                    java.lang.String componentCode,
                    java.lang.String networkCode,
                    java.lang.String locationCode,
                    long pickTime,
                    java.lang.String locatorPhase,
                    java.lang.String originalPhase,
                    boolean usePick,
                    int authorType,
                    double pickAffinity,
                    double pickQuality)
        The following Locator input parameters are expected for each pick.
        Parameters:
        source - Source of the database pick ID (optional).
        pickID - Hydra database pick ID (optional).
        stationCode - Station code.
        componentCode - Component code.
        networkCode - Network code.
        locationCode - Location code.
        pickTime - Pick time in milliseconds.
        locatorPhase - Current locator seismic phase code.
        originalPhase - Original seismic phase code.
        usePick - If true, this pick may be used in the location.
        authorType - 1 = automatic contributed, 2 = automatic NEIC, 3 = analyst contributed, 4 = NEIC analyst.
        pickAffinity - The higher the affinity, the harder it is to re-identify a pick. By default, the affinity for the four author types would be 1.0, 1.0, 1.5, and 3.0 respectively.
        pickQuality - The pick standard deviation in seconds.
